oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Confederate veteran William R. Campbell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Campbell served as a private in Co. D, 8th Ark. Inf., CSA. Seen here in a United Confederate Veterans uniform, he held a tattered Confederate battle flag and posed with a young lady wearing a sash with the words "MAID OF HONOR." Campbell fought at Shiloh and Murfreesboro, and was wounded at both Chickamauga and Atlanta. He wore a wooden peg leg because his foot was shot off at the Battle of Franklin. He was a prisoner in Nashville, then Camp Chase, Ohio, and later paroled at Vicksburg, Miss.
